Source: NSW Health Service Health Professionals (State) Award 2025 (Table 1 — Medical Officers); ASMOF NSW pay schedules; health.nsw.gov.au/careers/conditions
Notes: Single nodal point for Year 1 Hospital Medical Officer (HMO/Intern). NSW reference state. Qld MOCA7 comparable rate ~$87,448. Base salary only — excludes overtime, shift penalties (which can add 20-40% to total remuneration), professional development allowance ($1,675/yr), on-call payments, and rural incentives. Superannuation (12% from 1 Jul 2025) is employer-paid on top. NSW public hospitals provide salary packaging (up to $9,010 meal/entertainment + $2,650 living expenses tax-free) which increases effective take-home.

Source: NSW Health Service Health Professionals (State) Award 2025 (Table 1 — Medical Officers Years 2-4); ASMOF NSW pay schedules; health.nsw.gov.au/careers/conditions
Notes: Min=PGY2 (Year 2 HMO); Typical=PGY3 (Year 3 HMO); Max=Year 4 HMO. NSW reference state. Qld MOCA7 comparable: PGY2 ~$97,615 / PGY3 ~$103,200. Base salary only — excludes overtime (which is substantial for RMOs — often 10-20 hrs/wk), shift penalties, professional development allowance, on-call payments, and rural incentives. Superannuation 12% employer-paid on top. Salary packaging benefits apply (see Intern note).

Source: NSW Health Service Health Professionals (State) Award 2025 (Table 1 — Registrar/Senior Registrar); ASMOF NSW pay schedules; health.nsw.gov.au/careers/conditions; Qld Health MOCA7 registrar rates for cross-reference
Notes: Min=Registrar Year 1 (unaccredited or early accredited training); Typical=Registrar Year 3-4 (mid-training); Max=Senior Registrar Year 6+ (final year of advanced training). NSW reference state. Qld MOCA7 comparable range: $123,000-$165,000. Base salary only — excludes overtime, shift penalties, on-call payments, teaching/exam allowances, rural incentives. Many registrars earn $180k-$220k+ total with overtime and penalties. Superannuation 12% employer-paid on top. Salary packaging benefits apply.

Source: Seek.com.au medical registrar listings Feb 2026; Glassdoor private hospital registrar salaries; Healthcarelink salary data; AMA Victoria private sector survey 2024
Notes: ESTIMATED. Private hospital registrar roles (Ramsay Health Care, Healthscope, St Vincent's Private, etc.). Range reflects base salary packages advertised on job boards. Min=smaller private hospitals / less competitive specialties; Typical=mid-range private hospital in metropolitan area; Max=high-demand surgical or procedural specialties at major private hospitals. Private registrars often receive higher base but may have fewer structured overtime hours than public. Some private roles are salaried-only (no overtime entitlement). Superannuation 12% on top. Verify against current Seek/Indeed listings.

Source: NSW Staff Specialists (State) Award 2025; NSW Health Staff Specialist pay scales; health.nsw.gov.au/careers/conditions; ASMOF NSW Staff Specialist rates; Qld Health MOCA7 Senior Medical Officer/Specialist rates for cross-reference
Notes: Min=Staff Specialist Year 1 (new consultant appointment); Typical=Staff Specialist Year 5-6 (mid-career); Max=Staff Specialist Year 10+ (top of scale) or Senior Staff Specialist. NSW reference state. Qld Health comparable: SMO L18-L24 range ~$215,000-$310,000. Base salary only — excludes Private Practice Allowance (Type A/B/C — can add $30k-$130k+), overtime, on-call payments, Attraction & Retention Allowances, Exceptional Performance payments, and academic loadings. Total remuneration packages for Staff Specialists commonly $350k-$500k+. Superannuation 12% employer-paid on top. Salary packaging benefits apply.

Source: AMA National Specialist Survey 2024; Seek.com.au specialist/consultant listings; Glassdoor; MedRecruit salary data; MABEL longitudinal survey of Australian doctors; ATO taxable income statistics for medical practitioners
Notes: ESTIMATED. Enormous variation by specialty, practice model, and geography. Min=early-career specialist in lower-earning specialty (psychiatry, paediatrics, public health) or salaried VMO at private hospital; Typical=established specialist with mixed public/private practice or full-time private group practice (reflects ATO median taxable income for specialists ~$350k-$400k); Max=high-volume procedural specialist (orthopaedics, ophthalmology, cardiology, radiology) in established private practice. ATO data shows top-decile specialists earn $600k-$1M+. Figures represent gross practice income minus practice costs for sole practitioners, or employment salary for salaried private specialists. Superannuation arrangements vary (employed: 12% SG; self-employed: voluntary). Verify against AMA survey and ATO profession statistics.
